org.turbogwt.core.future.shared

Interface Promise<D,F,P,C extends Context>

  • Type Parameters:
    D - Type used for done(DoneCallback)
    F - Type used for fail(FailCallback)
    P - The type of the progress notification
    C - The type of the context info on always callback
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Deferred<D,F,P,C>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDeferred, AbstractPromise, DeferredObject

    public interface Promise<D,F,P,C extends Context>
    Promise interface to observe when some action has occurred on the corresponding Deferred object. A promise object should be obtained from Deferred#promise()), or by using DeferredManager. 
     
 Deferred deferredObject = new DeferredObject();
 Promise promise = deferredObject.promise();
 promise.done(new DoneCallback() {
   void onDone(Object result) {
       // Done!
   }
 });

 // another thread using the same deferredObject
 deferredObject.resolve("OK");
    Author:
    Ray Tsang, Danilo Reinert
    See Also:
    Deferred.resolve(Object), Deferred.reject(Object), Deferred.notify(Object)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Promise.State
      State of a Promise

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Promise<D,F,P,C> always(AlwaysCallback<D,F,C> callback)
      This method will register AlwaysCallback so that when it's always triggered regardless of whether the corresponding Deferred object was resolved or rejected.
      Promise<D,F,P,C> done(DoneCallback<D> callback)
      This method will register DoneCallback so that when a Deferred object is resolved (Deferred.resolve(Object)), DoneCallback will be triggered.
      Promise<D,F,P,C> fail(FailCallback<F> callback)
      This method will register FailCallback so that when a Deferred object is rejected (Deferred.reject(Object)), FailCallback will be triggered.
      boolean isPending() 
      boolean isRejected() 
      boolean isResolved() 
      Promise<D,F,P,C> progress(ProgressCallback<P> callback)
      This method will register ProgressCallback so that when a Deferred object is notified of progress (Deferred.notify(Object)), ProgressCallback will be triggered.
      Promise.State state()

      • done

        Promise<D,F,P,C> done(DoneCallback<D> callback)
        This method will register DoneCallback so that when a Deferred object is resolved (Deferred.resolve(Object)), DoneCallback will be triggered. You can register multiple DoneCallback by calling the method multiple times. The order of callback trigger is based on the order you call this method. 
         
 promise.progress(new DoneCallback(){
   void onDone(Object done) {
     ...
   }
 });
        Parameters:
        callback -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        Deferred.resolve(Object)

      • fail

        Promise<D,F,P,C> fail(FailCallback<F> callback)
        This method will register FailCallback so that when a Deferred object is rejected (Deferred.reject(Object)), FailCallback will be triggered. You can register multiple FailCallback by calling the method multiple times. The order of callback trigger is based on the order you call this method. 
         
 promise.fail(new FaillCallback(){
   void onFail(Object rejection) {
     ...
   }
 });
        Parameters:
        callback -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        Deferred.reject(Object)

      • always

        Promise<D,F,P,C> always(AlwaysCallback<D,F,C> callback)
        This method will register AlwaysCallback so that when it's always triggered regardless of whether the corresponding Deferred object was resolved or rejected. You can register multiple AlwaysCallback by calling the method multiple times. The order of callback trigger is based on the order you call this method. 
         
 promise.always(new AlwaysCallback(){
   void onAlways(Context context, Object result, Object rejection) {
     if (context.getState() == State.RESOLVED) {
       // do something w/ result
     } else {
       // do something w/ rejection
     }
   }
 });
        Parameters:
        callback -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        Deferred.resolve(Object), Deferred.reject(Object)

      • progress

        Promise<D,F,P,C> progress(ProgressCallback<P> callback)
        This method will register ProgressCallback so that when a Deferred object is notified of progress (Deferred.notify(Object)), ProgressCallback will be triggered. You can register multiple ProgressCallback by calling the method multiple times. The order of callback trigger is based on the order you call this method. 
         
 promise.progress(new ProgressCallback(){
   public void onProgress(Object progress) {
     // e.g., update progress in the GUI while the background task is still running.
   }
 });
        Parameters:
        callback -
        Returns:
        See Also:
        Deferred.notify(Object)
